title: What to expect from Rory and Scottie, and how will Royal Portrush play?
content: Is Scottie Scheffler the overwhelming favorite? Is Rory McIlroy's game rounding into form? We look at five storylines to watch this week at the Open Championship.

title: Agent: Beal OK's buyout with Suns, to join Clips
content: Bradley Beal has agreed to a buyout with the Suns and plans to join the Clippers on a two-year, $11M deal with an option after he clears waivers, his agent told ESPN.

title: Fever's Clark (groin) downgraded to out vs. Liberty
content: Fever star Caitlin Clark, who injured her right groin late in Tuesday night's win over the Sun, was ruled out for Wednesday night's game against the Liberty.

title: Chargers' Harris (eye) likely to start camp on NFI
content: Chargers running back Najee Harris, who has an eye injury, will likely begin training camp on the NFI list, general manager Joe Hortiz said Wednesday.

title: 5-star Boozer: Duke 'overlooked,' but not for long
content: Five-star prospect and incoming Duke freshman Cameron Boozer told ESPN on Wednesday the Blue Devils have been "overlooked" this offseason following the departures of Cooper Flagg and other NBA talent.

title: Sources: Oakmont bars Clark over locker damage
content: Oakmont Country Club has banned golfer Wyndham Clark from its property after he damaged his locker following a missed cut at last month's U.S. Open, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Belichick pushes back on Kraft: Pats job 'big risk'
content: On the heels of comments by Robert Kraft, Bill Belichick said he was the one who took the risk to join the Patriots in 1999.

title: Cubs icon Sandberg 'continuing to fight' cancer
content: Cubs legend Ryne Sandberg said he is "continuing to fight" cancer and is prioritizing time with those closest to him.

title: Rangers give All-Star bonus to snubbed Eovaldi
content: Rangers pitcher Nathan Eovaldi, who wasn't selected as an All-Star despite posting a 1.58 ERA in the first half, was given a $100,000 All-Star bonus by the team anyway.

title: üèà Barnwell: Ranking best NFL teams since 2000
content: With 25 NFL seasons in the books since 2000, let's pick the 25 best teams. How many Patriots, Eagles and Chiefs squads make the list?

title: B- for the Fever? A- for Valkyries? Grading every WNBA team at midseason
content: The Valkyries join the Lynx and Mercury near the front of the class, while the Fever and Sky have improved marks.

title: Who are the NFL's best wide receivers? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: The clear two-man race features two stars who grew up about 10 miles apart, played at LSU together and are trading blows for the No. 1 ranking each year.

title: The 20 most interesting storylines at NFL training camps
content: What are the most important positional battles and injuries to monitor at NFL training camps? Ben Solak gives his picks.

title: Passan: Inside the first swing-off in MLB All-Star Game history
content: On a night full of firsts, none resonated as much as the finale -- and Kyle Schwarber's titanic performance.

title: Grading 30-plus NBA deals, including Booker's historic -- and risky -- extension
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including max deals for Booker, Gilgeous-Alexander and Banchero.

title: From New Jersey to Madrid via Brazil, Atl√©tico is next big step for USMNT's Johnny Cardoso
content: Johnny Cardoso had a difficult summer with the U.S., but joining Atl√©tico Madrid is a chance to step up and meet a new challenge. He's used to that.

title: 2025 MLB draft recap: Best picks, biggest steals and analysis for all 30 teams
content: Now that all 20 rounds are complete, it's time to see what Kiley McDaniel makes of your team's draft haul.

title: Betting: Top storylines for the season's second half
content: There is increasing interest in the AL MVP race as well as an emerging NL Rookie of the Year contender.

title: Why a 46-year-old Pacquiao is boxing again
content: Manny Pacquiao is back to a familiar place in Los Angeles, looking for a new start and to add to his legendary career.

title: Building Duke's all-time roster: Does Cooper Flagg make the cut?
content: Some names were obvious (Hill, Laettner). Others sparked a debate (Flagg, Williamson). But we think we got the all-time roster right.

title: 'I'm like, I know it's you': Arch Manning, Lane Kiffin headline top SEC media day quotes
content: Conference media days are always ripe with quality quotes, and the witticisms from Atlanta did not disappoint.

title: Euro 2025 Power Rankings: Spain still the favorite, England a close second
content: Euro 2025 is down to the final eight teams who have the chance to get their hands on the trophy in Switzerland. We ranked them in order.

title: Revitalized Sweden pose serious threat to England
content: Three years ago when the teams met, the score was one-sided. This Swedish team is a different proposition, though.

title: Yamal given Messi's iconic Bar√ßa No. 10 jersey
content: Lamine Yamal has been handed the iconic Barcelona No. 10 shirt previously worn by Lionel Messi, the Catalan club confirmed Wednesday.

title: Nico Williams explains 10-year Athletic extension
content: Nico Williams said he wants to continue making history at Athletic Club having turned down offers to leave the Basque outfit this summer.

title: Poland hire new coach after Lewandowski fallout
content: Jan Urban has been appointed as Poland national manager, the country's football association (PZPN) said on Wednesday, with the 63-year-old replacing Michal Probierz who resigned in June.

title: Angel City's King eyes full recovery after collapse
content: Angel City FC defender Savy King credited the team's medical staff for saving her life in May when she collapsed on the field during an NWSL game in May.

title: 'Great club legend' V√°zquez's time in Madrid over
content: Lucas V√°zquez, an important player for Real Madrid during one of its most successful eras, is ending his stint with the Spanish powerhouse.

title: Freese 'devastated' but hungry after Mexico loss
content: USMNT goalkeeper Matt Freese said he felt devastated following the Gold Cup final loss to Mexico, but insists it will be motivation for the World Cup.

title: USMNT's Johnny Cardoso joins Atl√©tico Madrid
content: United States national team midfielder Johnny Cardoso has completed his transfer to Atl√©tico Madrid from Real Betis.

title: Alexander-Arnold transformed Liverpool. Will he do the same for Real Madrid?
content: Trent Alexander-Arnold left the Premier League as one of its best players ever. Whether he can reach similar heights in LaLiga as a Real Madrid player will be fascinating to watch.

title: Ward, McMillan and others primed to follow path of 2024 breakouts
content: These players are in position to follow a similar path to last year's breakouts and produce big numbers.

title: Year 2 player spotlight: Maye, Harrison, Odunze among popular breakouts
content: The ESPN Fantasy staff lists NFL sophomores who are undervalued in drafts and others who are under scrutiny.

title: Waiver wire: Start the second half strong with these pickups
content: As the MLB season's second half gets ready to begin, here are the players you should claim off the fantasy waiver wire.

title: Behind the scenes with a heavyweight champion
content: ESPN goes behind the scenes in camp with Oleksandr Usyk ahead of his undisputed heavyweight title fight against Daniel Dubois on July 19.

title: X factors for every Top 25 team: What could make (or break) the season
content: Every team has a key player, position group or situation that could swing its season. We break them all down.

title: Ranking CFB's best coaches, from Ryan Day and Dabo Swinney to ... Rhett Lashlee?
content: Is Ryan Day a genius or could anyone win at Ohio State? We break down 20 years of sideline overachievers.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool to rival Newcastle for Franfkurt's Ekitike
content: Liverpool have joined the race to sign Eintracht Frankfurt forward Hugo Ekitike. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Massive quake: 7.3 tremor strikes off Alaska coast; tsunami warning issued
content: A significant 7.3 magnitude earthquake struck the coast of Alaska on Wednesday, triggering a tsunami warning across a large portion of the Alaska Peninsula and extending towards Anchorage. The earthquake, centered off Sand Point on Popof Island, prompted the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to issue the warning due to the potential for serious damage.

title: Narco nexus: Indo-Canadian drug lord held in US; ISI-China-Khalistan links found
content: The US Drug Enforcement Agency dismantled an international drug cartel with ties to the ISI, China, and Canada, arresting Opinder Singh Sian, also known as Thanos. Sian operated a global fentanyl and methamphetamine trafficking ring from British Columbia.

title: Can‚Äôt win today's warfare with yesterday‚Äôs weapons, desi drone tech must: CDS Chauhan
content: General Anil Chauhan emphasized the critical need for India to develop indigenous drone and counter-UAS technologies to maintain a strategic advantage. He highlighted Operation Sindoor, where Pakistan's drones caused no damage, underscoring the limitations of relying on foreign systems.

title: Rahul, Kharge write to PM Modi for J&K statehood; CM Omar Abdullah welcomes move
content: Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge have urged Prime Minister Modi to restore statehood to Jammu & Kashmir via a parliamentary bill during the monsoon session. They also advocated for Sixth Schedule constitutional safeguards for Ladakh, addressing cultural, developmental, and political needs while protecting rights and identity.

title: Bengali-speaker raids: Calcutta HC steps in; demands Centre‚Äôs clarification
content: Calcutta High Court has directed the Union government to clarify the rationale behind the nationwide raids targeting Bengali-speaking individuals, suspecting them as illegal Bangladeshi migrants. The court raised concerns about potential wrongful acts and illegal deportations based solely on language.

title: Goldman Sachs hires a new employee that could be a 'nightmare' for engineering graduates
content: Goldman Sachs is set to revolutionize its software development by integrating Devin, an AI software engineer, aiming to enhance productivity and automate routine tasks. This move signals a significant shift in the financial industry's labor dynamics, potentially impacting entry-level positions as AI coders become integral to the workforce.

title: Take call by Monday on screening of Udaipur Files - Supreme Court to I&B ministry
content: The Supreme Court has directed a special committee to review the film 'Udaipur Files: Kanhaiya Lal Tailor Murder' following objections to its release. Petitioners argue the film vilifies Muslims, prejudices the ongoing trial, and endangers the accused. The court has also ordered police protection for the film's producer and his son, who have received death threats.

title: India violating pacts, carrying on push-ins, says Bangladesh
content: Bangladesh's foreign affairs adviser, Md Touhid Hossain, has alleged that India continues to "push-in" citizens into Bangladesh, violating bilateral agreements on repatriation. He criticized the BSF for killings along the border, asserting that border forces lack the authority to fatally shoot individuals violating border laws.

title: 'Akbar brutal, Babur ruthless': NCERT gives Mughal era a makeover; adds a no-blame footnote
content: NCERT‚Äôs new Class 8 Social Science textbook reframes medieval Indian history, including the Mughal era, with a balanced, critical lens. While detailing events like Babur‚Äôs invasions and Akbar‚Äôs conquests, it avoids assigning blame, urging students to analyse rather than judge. The textbook promotes understanding complex pasts to foster empathy, reflection, and informed citizenship in today‚Äôs learners.

title: TCS gives 100% variable pay to 70% employees; Payment to rest of employees will be based on ...
content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) will provide 100% variable pay to approximately 70% of its employees up to the C2 grade for the June quarter. Variable pay for employees in the C3 grade and above will be determined by the performance of their respective business units.

title: Compelling dead marriage to go on perpetuates mental agony: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court of India has ruled that courts can grant divorce when a marriage is irretrievably broken, ending a 16-year matrimonial dispute. Justices Nath and Mehta invoked Article 142, emphasizing that forcing couples to stay in 'dead marriages' causes mental agony.

title: 'You have scope to come to our side': Fadnavis's swipe at Uddhav or message to Shinde?
content: Devendra Fadnavis  "invitation" swipe at Uddhav Thackeray has reignited speculation about potential realignments within Maharashtra's political landscape. This comes amid reports of unease between Fadnavis and Eknath Shinde, particularly concerning the upcoming BMC elections and the conduct of Shinde Sena MLAs.

title: Anand Mahindra's message to Elon Musk on Tesla India launch: Meet you at ...
content: Anand Mahindra welcomed Elon Musk and Tesla to India as the EV company officially debuted with its first showroom, the Tesla Experience Centre, in Mumbai. Mahindra expressed optimism and acknowledged the competition Tesla brings to India's growing EV sector. Tesla has launched its Model Y in India, with prices starting at Rs 61 lakh.

title: India-US trade deal: Trump says 'another deal coming up, maybe with India'
content: US President Donald Trump announced the possibility of a new trade deal with India, coinciding with ongoing trade talks between Indian commerce officials and the US in Washington DC. The US administration is reportedly considering offering India a tariff rate below 20%, seeking market access in India, similar to the recent agreement with Indonesia.

title: Luka Doncic sparks exit buzz; Lakers‚Äô LeBron treatment blamed
content: Luka Doncic's future with the Los Angeles Lakers is uncertain as he approaches a player option in 2025-26. Tension arises from the Lakers' apparent shift towards prioritizing Doncic over LeBron James, potentially alienating the Slovenian star. Concerns grow that the Lakers' treatment of James could impact Doncic's trust and willingness to commit long-term.

title: Massive prediction! KL Rahul tipped to eclipse Shubman Gill soon
content: Former England cricketer Owais Shah predicts KL Rahul will thrive in Test cricket, stepping out of Virat Kohli's shadow. Shah highlights Rahul's technique and mental strength, anticipating he'll become India's primary batting pillar, potentially outscoring Shubman Gill over time. Rahul's recent century at Lord's, a historic feat, underscores his potential.

title: Magic Johnson: Ends luxury getaway; Cookie Johnson joins him
content: Magic Johnson and his wife, Cookie, recently concluded their European vacation, sharing joyful moments with family and friends on Instagram. The trip included stops in Monaco, Croatia, Portofino, and Cannes, filled with fine dining, attending plays, and yacht retreats. Magic emphasized family time, posting a group photo with his children and grandchildren, highlighting his role as a dedicated family man.

title: Conor McGregor breaks silence: Cryptic tweet after Azealia Banks leak
content: Azealia Banks ignited a social media storm by claiming Conor McGregor, celebrating his birthday in Italy, sent her nude photos. Instead of directly addressing the allegations, McGregor responded to a fan's joke with a political comment about Irish politics. Banks further alleged a long history of nude exchanges and harassment, while McGregor continued posting from his yacht, seemingly unfazed.

title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce unite ‚Äî support Scott Swift‚Äôs recovery
content: Taylor Swift prioritized her family as her father, Scott Swift, underwent a quintuple bypass surgery last month. She paused her Eras Tour obligations to be with him, along with her mother, Andrea, and brother, Austin. Travis Kelce, her boyfriend, offered his support during this challenging time, as the family focused on Scott's recovery following the procedure.

title: India likely to get 3 Apache attack choppers from US on July 21
content: The Indian Army is set to receive its first consignment of three Apache attack helicopters from the US on July 21, significantly boosting its combat capabilities. These AH-64E Apaches, known for their firepower, will be stationed at Hindon Air Force Station. This acquisition follows a previous deal where the IAF received 22 Apache helicopters, enhancing India's joint operation capabilities.

title: From Isro missions to atoms, new NCERT standard 8 textbook maps India's scientific legacy
content: NCERT's new Class 8 Science textbook, 'Curiosity,' blends traditional Indian knowledge with modern science, highlighting India's scientific legacy. It introduces concepts like Acharya Kanad's 'Parmanu' and ISRO missions, while also referencing ancient astronomers' understanding of reflection.

title: Bradley Beal joins Clippers; Suns buyout clears path ‚Äî Signs 2-yr deal with player option
content: Three-time All-Star guard Bradley Beal is heading to the Los Angeles Clippers after finalizing a contract buyout with the Phoenix Suns. Beal, who had two years and $110.8 million remaining on his contract, forfeited $13.9 million to secure his release. The Suns will use the "waive-and-stretch" provision to manage the remaining salary.

title: Air India crash fallout: Videos should be installed in cockpits, says IATA chief
content: IATA's Willie Walsh advocates for cockpit video recording to enhance accident investigations, citing the Air India crash as a potential case where video evidence could have been invaluable.

title: Jaish ultra killed in Basantgarh operation was a top commander: J&K DGP
content: A top Jaish-e-Mohammad commander, identified as Haider, was killed in an encounter with security forces in Udhampur district's Basantgarh, as confirmed by J&K DGP Nalin Prabhat. Haider had been active in the Dudu-Basantgarh forests for four years. The DGP highlighted ongoing anti-terror operations in the Union Territory during an event in Akhnoor.

title: Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh high court denies bail to accused in narco-terror case
content: The Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh High Court denied bail to a juvenile accused in a narco-terrorism case, who was to be tried as an adult. Investigations revealed the accused was actively involved with a narco-terror gang smuggling drugs and firearms from Pakistan, led by a Pakistan-based operative.

title: Olympic skier Audun Groenvold dies at 49 after lightning strike during cabin trip
content: Norwegian Olympic ski cross medalist Audun Groenvold tragically passed away at 49 after being struck by lightning while traveling to a cabin. Despite immediate transport to the hospital, his injuries were fatal. Groenvold, known for his 2010 Vancouver Winter Olympics bronze medal, had a successful career in both alpine and freestyle skiing, leaving a significant void in Norway's skiing community.

title: 'Not picking Kuldeep Yadav has hurt India; you can't expect him to score 100 runs'
content: Kuldeep Yadav's prolonged absence from the ongoing Test series in England has sparked debate, with his coach Kapil Dev Pandey advocating for his inclusion in the fourth Test at Old Trafford. Pandey emphasizes Kuldeep's current form and potential impact, especially given Manchester's spin-friendly conditions.

title: Kyrie Irving drops 3-word message as Phil Handy set to wear Dallas Mavericks jersey
content: Kyrie Irving and Phil Handy, reunited in Dallas, share a heartwarming moment as Handy joins the Mavericks' coaching staff. Their history dates back to the Cavaliers' 2016 championship run, where Handy played a crucial role in Irving's development. Irving greeted Handy with a cheerful, "Sup, Dallas Mav?!!" reflecting their bond.

title: Jeff Bezos' daily diet: From Octopus to nostalgic McDonald‚Äôs
content: Jeff Bezos's diet is a mix of extravagance and simplicity. He starts his day with octopus and yogurt, enjoys classic American diner food, and makes pancakes for his family. Bezos also indulges in fast food, particularly McDonald's, and adheres to a 'two-pizza rule' for meetings. Investing in plant-based proteins, he also appreciates Peking duck, reflecting his diverse tastes and philosophies.

title: Shocking! Ravi Shastri blames Karun Nair's 'huge lapse in concentration' for Lord's defeat
content: Ravi Shastri analyzed India's loss to England at Lord's. He highlighted Rishabh Pant's crucial dismissal before lunch. Karun Nair's wicket early in the second innings triggered a collapse. Shastri praised the lower order's fight but noted the top order's struggles. He drew parallels with India's 2021 Lord's win. Shastri remains optimistic about India's comeback in the series.

title: Israel strikes Syria‚Äôs military, defence ministry HQ; blast near presidential palace
content: Israel launched a direct strike on the Syrian military headquarters in Damascus following escalating violence against Druze civilians in southern Syria. The IDF confirmed the strike, targeting military infrastructure near the Defense Ministry, as part of a broader campaign to deter threats near Israel's northern border.

title: India-US trade deal: India wants Trump to offer tariff rate lower than Indonesia
content: India-US trade deal:  American President Trump aims for US market access into India, similar to the Indonesia trade deal. However, India seeks even lower tariffs, below Indonesia's 19%. Negotiations are underway, targeting rates under 20%, potentially even below 10%.

title: 'Can come to the ruling side': CM Fadnavis' offer for former ally Uddhav
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis hinted at a possible BJP-Shiv Sena (UBT) coalition, suggesting Uddhav Thackeray could join the ruling side. This remark comes amid Uddhav's criticism of the BJP and speculation about a reunion of the Thackeray cousins. MNS chief Raj Thackeray refuted claims of alliance talks with Uddhav, accusing journalists of misrepresenting his comments.

title: Indian man arrested in US for child porn; Cong, BJP link accused with AAP
content: Gurjeet Singh Malhi, an Indian man, was arrested in Washington by ICE on charges related to child sexual abuse material. The arrest has ignited a political firestorm in Punjab, with photographs circulating showing Malhi alongside leaders from AAP, Congress, SAD and BJP. Opposition parties are demanding clarification from AAP regarding Malhi's connections to party members.

title: Kyle Schwarber makes history: first Phillies All-Star MVP since 1964
content: Kyle Schwarber delivered a historic performance at the 2025 MLB All-Star Game, securing the MVP award with a clutch swing-off victory. His three consecutive home runs in the tiebreaker propelled the National League to a 7-6 win over the American League. This win marks the first time a Phillies player has won the All-Star Game MVP since 1964.

title: 7.3 Magnitude Earthquake Hits US' Alaska, Tsunami Warning Issued
content: A 7.3-magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of the US state of Alaska on Wednesday, triggering a tsunami warning, the US Geological Survey said.

title: Syria Says Withdrawing Troops After Agreeing To Ceasefire In Sweida
content: Syria announced it had begun withdrawing its army from Druze-majority Sweida city on Wednesday night after agreeing to a new ceasefire that it said would bring a complete halt to its military operations there.

title: Marco Rubio Says Steps Agreed To End Syria Fighting
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said there was an agreement to restore calm in Syria by late Wednesday, as he blamed misunderstandings over violence that included Israeli strikes on its neighbor's capital.

title: International Court Rejects Israel's Request To Withdraw Netanyahu's Arrest Warrant
content: Judges at the International Criminal Court rejected Israel's request to withdraw arrest warrants against its prime minister and former defence minister while the ICC reviews Israeli challenges to its jurisdiction over the conduct of the Gaza war.

title: US Aviation Body Not Considering Contracts With Musk's SpaceX Starlink
content: The Federal Aviation Administration told lawmakers it is not considering replacing its current telecommunication contracts it holds with L3Harris or Verizon Communications with Elon Musk's SpaceX's Starlink satellite unit.

title: Mosul Airport Reopens Years After ISIS Devastation
content: Iraqi Prime Minister Mohammed Shia al-Sudani inaugurated Wednesday the city of Mosul's newly restored airport, years after it was destroyed in the battle to dislodge the Islamic State group.

title: Ukraine's Wartime Reshuffle: What We Know
content: Following weeks of rumours, Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelensky this week unveiled a government reshuffle, replacing his prime minister and defence minister as he aims to inject fresh energy into his team, with no end in sight to the war.

title: Reinstated By High Court, Manipur Education Officers Still Allegedly Kept Out Of Office
content: The Manipur government has not reinstated two zonal education officers (ZEOs) despite an order by the Manipur High Court to do so, which could amount to contempt of court, an organisation representing the Thadou tribe said in a letter to Governor.

title: Siding With Pak, China: BJP's Jay Panda Trashes Congress Questions On Op Sindoor
content: The BJP's Jay Panda today ripped into the Congress over its plans to corner the government on Pahalgam attack and the subsequent Operation Sindoor in the upcoming session of parliament.

title: Iceland's Reykjanes Peninsula Volcano Erupts For 9th Time Since 2023
content: A volcano erupted on Wednesday in Iceland's Reykjanes peninsula in the southwest, weather authorities said, the ninth eruption to hit the region since the end of 2023.

title: "Won't Keep A Single Rupee": Singer On Radhika Yadav's Music Video
content: Independent artiste Inaam Ul Haq, who featured in a music video with tennis player Radhika Yadav, today shared a post on Instagram about the backlash he has been receiving after her death.

title: Emma Watson, Another 'Harry Potter' Star Banned From Driving In UK
content: Two stars of the "Harry Potter" films, including actress Emma Watson, were each banned from driving for six months Wednesday after being caught speeding in separate incidents.

title: 'Will Die By Suicide': Brother Of Odisha Woman Flags Trolling, Goes To Cops
content: The elder brother of the 20-year-old woman student in Odisha, who died after she set herself on fire in protest against sexual harassment by a professor, has filed a police complaint seeking protection for the family from cyber harassment.

title: Chennai Cocaine Case: Conditional Bail Granted To Actors Srikanth And Krishna
content: In a significant development in the Chennai cocaine case that has rocked the Tamil film industry, actors Srikanth and Krishna have been granted conditional bail by the Madras High Court.

title: 3 Killed After Clashes In Sheikh Hasina's Hometown In Bangladesh
content: At least three people were killed in Bangladesh on Wednesday after clashes broke out between police and supporters of ousted prime minister Sheikh Hasina, authorities said.

title: Trump Says He's 'Highly Unlikely' To Fire Fed's Powell
content: President Donald Trump said Wednesday that he was "highly unlikely" to fire, a public statement made less than 24 hours after suggesting in a private meeting that he was leaning in favor of dismissing the head of the nation's central bank.

title: Key Accused In Hyderabad's High-Profile "Digital Arrest" Fraud Case Arrested
content: A key accused in a high-profile "digital arrest" fraud case was arrested by the Cyber Crime Police in Hyderabad.

title: Israel Bombs Syria Army HQ Amid Fighting In Majority-Druze City Of Sweida
content: Israel bombed the Syrian army headquarters in Damascus on Wednesday after warning the Islamist-led government to leave the Druze minority alone in its Sweida heartland, where a war monitor says sectarian clashes have killed nearly 250 people.

title: Zelensky Aims To Win Over Both Public And Trump With Cabinet Reshuffle
content: Ukraine will get its first new prime minister of the war on Thursday, as President Volodymyr Zelensky tries to wrestle wartime defence spending into shape and win over both Donald Trump and a war-weary public with fresh-faced leadership.

title: "Meant To Overthrow The System": Iran's Khamenei On Israel's Attacks
content: Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said Wednesday that Israel's attacks during last month's 12-day war were intended to weaken the Islamic republic's system and spark unrest to topple it.

title: Naidu releases report of Task Force on Economic Development for Swarna Andhra Pradesh
content: The expert panel has made a host of recommendations to the government on diverse sectors that have the potential to catapult it to the league of progressive States

title: Gujarat launches India‚Äôs first tribal genome project to tackle inherited diseases
content: The Tribal Genome Sequencing Project is an initiative by the government to sequence the genomes of 2,000 people belonging to tribal communities across 17 districts in the State

title: A.P. and Telangana resolve key river water issues in New Delhi meeting
content: Both States agree to share data reservoirs and preserve Srisailam project;  KRMB will be headquartered in Amaravati, while GRMB will remain in Hyderabad

title: NHRC issues notice to Delhi and UP government over drowning of two kids in public places
content: Observing that the incidents raise serious issues of violation of human rights of the victims, the commission had issued notice calling for a detailed report on the matter within two weeks.

title: Calcutta High Court dismisses teachers‚Äô petitions against new SSC recruitment rules
content: ‚ÄòUntainted‚Äô teachers say they are losing faith in the judicial system to offer them justice and said they are being criminalised for corruption done by government authorities

title: BJP government in Uttarakhand promoting VIP culture: Congress
content: The party questions how the BKTC chairman was allowed to fly to Kedarnath by a chopper despite suspension of service

title: Four arrested for misappropriating CMRF funds worth ‚Çπ8.71 lakh using forged cheques
content: The accused are alleged to have forged documents and siphoned off government funds intended for financially distressed applicants

title: Hyderabad‚Äôs Bolarum saw highest ozone pollution this summer, says study
content: Between March 1 and May 31, Bolarum recorded 17 days when ground-level ozone levels breached the safe limit ‚Äî the highest in the city

title: Three held in CBI drive against mule account network across seven States
content: As part of ‚ÄòOperation Chakra-V,‚Äô the agency searched multiple locations in Delhi, Bihar, Madhya Pradesh, Kerala, Punjab, Andhra Pradesh, and Rajasthan.

title: J&K making rapid strides on path of peace and prosperity: L-G Manoj Sinha
content: Delivering a lecture at Gandhi Smriti in the national capital, the Lieutenant-Governor says Jammu and Kashmir‚Äôs economy had more than doubled over the past five years

title: Agreement for biogas plant in Kozhikode to be signed soon
content: The Corporation will hand over seven acres for the facility, where 150 tonnes of biowaste will be processed

title: No exemption from selection of minor courses this year, says CU Registrar
content: Students pursuing major (main) courses with minors under the four-year undergraduate programme in affiliated colleges must choose all minors from two groups offered by a discipline other than their major, says a circular issued on July 14

title: Kodenchery panchayat to launch digital biodiversity register
content: A 12-member committee has been formed in all the 21 wards to complete the task and release the digitised version on October 2, says panchayat president

title: Drains along M.G. Road in Kochi to be renovated to increase carrying capacity
content: Of the 9.40-km stretch, 2.60 km from Pharmacy Junction likely to be covered in initial phase; PWD to use ‚Çπ10 cr. under Operation Breakthrough

title: Schools in Kozhikode step up security with strengthened SPG network
content: The SPGs, functioning under the heads of institutions, mainly comprise student representatives, parent-teacher association nominees, and community members from diverse sectors who can closely monitor student movements

title: Air India finds no issues with locking mechanism of fuel control switch in B787 planes: Official
content: The official also said that all the Boeing 787-8 aircraft have undergone Throttle Control Module (TCM) replacement as per the Boeing maintenance schedule

title: Fencing out the voter in Bihar‚Äôs poll roll preparation
content: The Supreme Court must intervene, once again, in the matter of the Bihar Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls and ensure that the manner of the preparation meets India‚Äôs exacting constitutional standards

title: Suvendu demands ‚Äòthorough revision‚Äô of voter list in Bengal
content: West Bengal goes to the polls next year, while the Assembly election is due in Bihar later this year.

title: Govt will train CSCs in AI, address duplication in State govt efforts: Vaishnaw
content: The IT Minister felicitated CSC operators in remote and rural districts, and said the government would train CSC workers in AI and address issues arising from duplication of CSC work by State government initiatives.

title: Share of clean energy in India‚Äôs electricity less than 30% despite 50% of installed capacity
content: Despite the rise in clean energy, the slower rise utilisation is due to its lower ‚Äòcapacity utilisation factor‚Äô; flexibility in the grid and improved battery storage are the way forward, says expert

title: Flash floods: 16 families relocated at Maruthonkara in Kozhikode
content: Recue squads on alert in landslip-prone areas on the orders of the District Disaster Management Authority

title: AI will boost decision-making and operational precision, says Lt. General Manjinder Singh

title: Veteran Congress leader C.V. Padmarajan passes away

title: Man United bring back classic '90s 'snowflake' away kit for 2025-26

title: FIFA reveals details to apply for World Cup tickets
content:
Applications for tickets for the 2026 World Cup open Sept. 10, FIFA said Tuesday. The next edition of the tournament, which will be co-hosted by Canada, Mexico and the United States, kicks off at the Azteca Stadium in Mexico City on June 11. Soccer's world governing body FIFA said that due to anticipated high demand tickets would be released in phases. -  World Cup lessons from Club World Cup 
-  Club World Cup takeaways 
-  Infantino: Covered stadiums to be used at '26 WC It did not say if it would use dynamic pricing, as was the case for the Club World Cup, which saw ticket prices fluctuate wildly. "We're looking forward to welcoming the world back to North America, as Canada, Mexico and the United States host what will be the biggest and greatest sporting event ever," FIFA president Gianni Infantino said in a statement. "We encourage fans everywhere to get ready to secure their place -- these will be the most coveted seats in world sport."

title: Joel Embiid sees you
content: Embiid was a media darling, both wry fabulist and helpless confessor . he spent two years rehabbing from surgeries to his right foot in the summers of 2014 and 2015 . his son, Arthur, is upstairs preparing for her birthday celebration .

title: The NBA's Apron Club: Who's in, who's out and when OKC might join
content: the salary cap's second apron has leveled the playing field by reducing roster mechanisms for high-spending teams that are at or over the threshold . if you add a veteran with a high salary in a trade, your roster timeline is shortened .

title: Richards delivering on immense potential for USMNT, Crystal Palace
content: Mauricio Pochettino's men's national team could struggle at next year's world cup . defender Chris Richards was the team's best and most consistent player at the Gold Cup . but he's now a near-lock to be in the lineup when the world cup starts in less than a year .
